page.title: 15Flora of Emborough
page.content: Wood anemone, violets, primroses, cowslips and Solomon's seal herald the spring in Emborough. The scent of wild garlic pervades the lanes as the abudance of summer growth begins to appear. Cow parsley makes the lanes narrower while the Meadow Cranesbill makes everywhere a riot of blue. There are wild strawberries and raspberries to be found under the hedges while honeysuckle ad wild roses vie for prominence above. Poppies and thistles grow in gateways while the tall majestic foxgloves look on. In the dampness of Crock's Bottom orchids flower and stonecrop tumbles from the stone walls. As Autumn moves in blackberries and elderberries are ripe for picking. The old Man's beard clothes th bare hedges and the holly buses hold their scarlet berries aloft and await the winter snow.
